item.title: SLI, SLO, SLA, Error Budget - A Primer
item.description: I was once asked what in my opinion reliability of a distributed system was. My answer was a hodgepodge of various terms explaining that reliability is the ability of a system to not fail/withstand failures to some extent and still continue to serve traffic. As I gain more experience working with distributed systems, I’ve come to realize that reliability is a conversation. It is a conversation operators have with the systems, the underlying infrastructure, and the various services as we operate them and as we have them serve customers.
